items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the RTCDataChannel API. The data was copied from their corresponding event handlers, which matches the versions when the interface was added (or in the case of bufferedamountlow_event, when the related features were added).
items.title: Add Firefox versions for RTCDataChannel API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the RTCDataChannel API. The data was copied from their corresponding event handlers, which matches the versions when the interface was added.
items.title: Add Safari versions for RTCDataChannel API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the MediaStreamTrack API. The data was copied from their corresponding event handlers, which matches the versions when the interface was added.
items.title: Add Safari versions for MediaStreamTrack API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the MediaStream API. The data was copied from their corresponding event handlers, which matches the versions when the addTrack and removeTrack methods were added.
items.title: Add Safari versions for MediaStream API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the MediaStream API. The data was copied from their corresponding event handlers, which matches the versions when the addTrack and removeTrack methods were added.
items.title: Add Chromium versions for MediaStream API

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the supports_parameters_for_callback member of the setInterval and setTimeout globals, based upon commit history and date.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/cca0d93a59501c2bb4bdbf1ee233900f9e6af38e

Note: the commit has a title that implies this logic was previously handled with a [Custom] ExtAttr. However, the commit also adds logic for an arguments argument to the C++ bindings.
items.title: Add Chromium versions for api.set[Interval/Timeout].supports_parameters_for_callback

items.content_html: This PR adds the missing event handlers for when a browser goes offline or comes back online, using results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v4.0.0). Additionally, this PR copies the data for these new handlers to the events themselves.
items.title: Add WindowEventHandlers.on[offline/online]; add versions for events

items.content_html:
This PR removes the irrelevant onbeforeunload.custom_text_support member of the WindowEventHandlers API as per the corresponding data guidelines. The lack of current support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v4.0.0), even if the current BCD suggests support.

Note that this does not need a content update because the documentation does not mention custom text.
items.title: Remove api.WindowEventHandlers.onbeforeunload.custom_text_support from BCD

items.content_html:

items.title: Add Chromium versions for api.Window.scroll[X/Y].subpixel_precision

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the containsNode.partialContainment_parameter_optional member of the Selection API, based upon commit history and date.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0d91ded63135349f0d926bab4a3ac4fb1b080276

Note: in Chrome's IDL, this property was initially called allowPartial, followed by allowPartialContainment, before being referred to as partialContainment.
items.title: Add Chromium versions for api.Selection.containsNode.partialContainment_parameter_optional

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Chrome and Safari for the extend.offset_parameter_optional member of the Selection API. The reasoning behind these values are the same as #13064; please see that PR to see how these values were determined.
items.title: Add Chrome/Safari versions for api.Selection.extend.offset_parameter_optional

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Chrome and Safari for the collapse.offset_parameter_optional member of the Selection API. The reasoning behind these values are the same as #13064; please see that PR to see how these values were determined.
items.title: Add Chrome/Safari versions for api.Selection.collapse.offset_parameter_optional
